Description: Base sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos-stand, consisting of upper surface and edge, separated by large torus moulding; glaze unevenly fired; exterior: on upper surface, black-figure decoration consisting of feline paw and part of second to right; blob rosette as filling ornament; moulding glazed; on edge of base, part of three incised rosettes.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888, 0601.570.e, 1888, 0601.570.f, 1888, 0601.570.h and 1965,0930.808. See also Williams 1983, 13, note 20.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 480-1, no. B838)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13-6, fig. 12.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0268) (Phase 1)
